messages.message:
I set up a refiner program for test:
https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/refiner-v3/kerry/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Kennion-example/prog/test_bug.ibprog#
udfs it uses
https://www.instabase.com/kerry/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Kennion-example/scripts/test.py
it seems like if your urf has a string input that is _an array with non-string or non-object items_, such as an array of number (`"[1, 2, 3, 4]"`) or an empty array (`"[]"`), and if the udf `json.loads` that string input, youâ€™ll get an error. However, If a UDF directly calls `json.loads("[]")` in the code, it works fine (see `test_json_loads_from_code` in test.py)
The same ibprog works fine on prod.
Interestingly, `[{}]` input seems to work fine, so does `["foo"]`, just not an empty array or of numbers
